statement.p: What is the area of this floor in square feet?

solution.p: This floor area consists of a rectangular area (on the left) and a triangular area (on the right). First measurements should all be converted to the same unit.
Top edge: \displaystyle{14}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{4}\ \text{ in}={172}\ \text{ in}
Left edge: \displaystyle{7}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{5}\ \text{ in}={89}\ \text{ in}
Bottom edge: \displaystyle{8}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{2}\ \text{ in}={98}\ \text{ in}
We do not need the length of the right edge (angled).
The area of the rectangle is \displaystyle{\left({89}\ \text{ in}\right)}{\left({98}\ \text{ in}\right)}={8722}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}.

The triangles top edge has length \displaystyle{\left({172}\ \text{ in}\right)}-{\left({98}\ \text{ in}\right)}={74}\ \text{ in}. The left edge is 89 in. Thus the area of the triangle is \displaystyle\frac{{1}}{{2}}{\left({89}\ \text{ in}\right)}{\left({74}\ \text{ in}\right)}={3293}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}.

Thus the total area is \displaystyle{8722}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}+{3293}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}={12015}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}. Converting this to square feet it becomes \displaystyle{12015}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}\cdot{\left(\frac{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}\right)}^{{2}}=\frac{{12015}}{{144}}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}={83.4375}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}\approx{83}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}.
